page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Persuing one of his hobbies Mr Will Breese has made,on a rough piece of ground,near his house an interesting small industrial museum. Pieces of machinery used in the past in surrounding quarries & on the old tramline through the village are carefully painted, arranged & labelled Old photographs of villagers, many now dead, engaged in their daily work are displayed in glass frames and a fascinating model of a working quarry is one of the highlights of the scene. Summer visitors may often be seen admiring the exhibits. No charge is made but donations may be given to a Railway charity for the blind. Mr Breese now retired from his job as railway signalman is the right man to consult about Aberangell in the past.
